The Inaugural Ball will be held on Monday, January 23rd, 2017 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington, D.C. The doors will open at 6:00 p.m. and the event will conclude at 12:00 a.m. (midnight). Please note that this is not an official White House event.
The Donald J. Trump Inaugural Ball is the largest and most anticipated event of the 58th Presidential Inauguration. This year’s Inaugural Ball will be held in the Walter E. Washington Convention Center, which will accommodate up to 10,000 guests. The venue is located at 801 Mount Vernon Place, NW, Washington, DC 20001. Parking is available on site. Please visit http://www.washingtonconventioncenter.com/ for more information.
This event will feature live entertainment and dancing. It will also include a special appearance by President-elect Donald J. Trump and First Lady Melania Trump.
Tickets are $250 per person. All proceeds from the sale of tickets benefit the Trump National Golf Club Charitable Foundation, Inc., a 501(c)(3) charitable organization. For more information about the Trump National Golf Club Charitable Foundation, please visit www.trumpcharity.org.
All ticket sales are final. Tickets may not be resold or transferred. If you have any questions regarding your order, please contact us at |||EMAIL_ADDRESS||| or call |||PHONE_NUMBER||| . For all other inquiries, please contact us at |||EMAIL_ADDRESS||| or call |||PHONE_NUMBER||| . Thank you for your support! We look forward to seeing you there. #TrumpInauguralBall #Trump2016 #TrumpTrain #MakeAmericaGreatAgain!

original_tweet: The 60th Presidential Inauguration Ceremony https://t.co/kTB4w2VCdI
prefix: The 60th Presidential Inauguration
original_completion: Ceremony https://t.co/kTB4w2VCdI
completion:
of the United States of America was held on January 20, 2017. The inauguration marked the commencement of the second and final term of Donald Trump as President and Mike Pence as Vice President. The ceremony took place on the West Front of the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C. It began at 11:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The inaugural parade followed the ceremony. A pre-inaugural concert was held on the evening of January 19, 2017.
The 2017 presidential inauguration was the first to be held since the 2016 United States federal election, which saw Trump defeat Hillary Clinton, the Democratic Party nominee, by winning 306 electoral votes to Clinton's 232. Trump won the popular vote by 46.1% to Clinton's 48.2%, but the Electoral College system awarded him the presidency. Trump was also the first president-elect to not attend the previous president's farewell address since Zachary Taylor in 1848.
Trump's inauguration drew a large crowd, with estimates ranging from 150,000 to 250,000 people. The event was broadcast live on ABC, CBS, CNN, C-SPAN, Fox News, MSNBC, NBC, and PBS. It was also streamed live online via the White House website, YouTube, and Facebook. Trump's inaugural address focused on themes of national unity, economic growth, and American exceptionalism. He also promised to protect the Second Amendment and build a wall along the southern border of the United States. Trump was sworn in by Chief Justice John Roberts. The oath of office was administered on the Bible of his mother, Mary MacLeod Trump. The inaugural parade featured military units, floats, marching bands, and equestrian performances. The parade was led by the 3rd U.S. Infantry Regiment (The Old Guard) and ended at the White House. The 2017 Inaugural Ball was held at the National Building Museum and featured performances by Carrie Underwood, Lee Greenwood, and Reba McEntire. It was attended by 1,000 guests.
The 2017 inauguration was the most expensive in U.S. history, costing $106 million, including $21 million in federal funds. It was also the first inauguration to be held after the January 6, 2021 attack on the Capitol, and

The 60th Presidential Inauguration of the United States of America was held on January 20, 2017. The inauguration marked the commencement of the second and final term of Donald Trump as President and Mike Pence as Vice President. The ceremony took place on the West Front of the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C. It began at 11:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The inaugural parade followed the ceremony. A pre-inaugural concert was held on the evening of January 19, 2017.
The 2017 presidential inauguration was the first to be held since the 2016 United States federal election, which saw Trump defeat Hillary Clinton, the Democratic Party nominee, by winning 306 electoral votes to Clinton's 232. Trump won the popular vote by 46.1% to Clinton's 48.2%, but the Electoral College system awarded him the presidency. Trump was also the first president-elect to not attend the previous president's farewell address since Zachary Taylor in 1848.
Trump's inauguration drew a large crowd, with estimates ranging from 150,000 to 250,000 people. The event was broadcast live on ABC, CBS, CNN, C-SPAN, Fox News, MSNBC, NBC, and PBS. It was also streamed live online via the White House website, YouTube, and Facebook. Trump's inaugural address focused on themes of national unity, economic growth, and American exceptionalism. He also promised to protect the Second Amendment and build a wall along the southern border of the United States. Trump was sworn in by Chief Justice John Roberts. The oath of office was administered on the Bible of his mother, Mary MacLeod Trump. The inaugural parade featured military units, floats, marching bands, and equestrian performances. The parade was led by the 3rd U.S. Infantry Regiment (The Old Guard) and ended at the White House. The 2017 Inaugural Ball was held at the National Building Museum and featured performances by Carrie Underwood, Lee Greenwood, and Reba McEntire. It was attended by 1,000 guests.

original_tweet: THE GOLDEN AGE OF AMERICA BEGINS RIGHT NOW! https://t.co/PSfDlAFpeO
prefix: THE GOLDEN AGE OF AMERICA
original_completion: BEGINS RIGHT NOW! https://t.co/PSfDlAFpeO
completion:
The Golden Age of America was the period from 1945 to 1970. During this time, America was the world’s dominant economic and military power. It had the largest economy in the world, and it was also the most prosperous country in the world.
The United States had a strong manufacturing sector that produced goods for both domestic consumption and export. The country also had a large agricultural sector that provided food for its citizens and exported surplus production to other countries.
The American Dream was alive and well during this era. People believed that hard work would lead to success, and many Americans were able to achieve their goals through education, entrepreneurship, and innovation. The government supported these efforts with policies that encouraged business growth and job creation.
During the Golden Age of America, there was a sense of optimism about the future. People believed that they could make a better life for themselves and their families if they worked hard enough. This attitude helped fuel economic growth and social progress.
The Golden Age of America came to an end in the early 1970s when inflation began to rise rapidly. This led to higher interest rates, which made it more difficult for businesses to borrow money and expand operations. As a result, economic growth slowed down significantly.
Since then, the U.S. has been struggling to return to the prosperity it enjoyed during its Golden Age. However, some argue that we are now entering another Golden Age of America as our economy continues to grow and create jobs at record levels. Only time will tell if this is true or not.
What caused the Golden Age?
There were several factors that contributed to the Golden Age of America:
- World War II: The United States emerged from World War II as the world’s dominant economic and military power. The war had a profound impact on the country’s economy, leading to increased industrial output and employment.
- Post-war boom: After the war ended, there was a massive surge in consumer spending as people bought homes, cars, and other goods. This helped fuel economic growth and created new industries.
- Technological advancements: The post-war years saw significant technological advancements that improved productivity and efficiency in manufacturing and agriculture. These innovations helped drive economic growth.
- Government policies: The government implemented policies that supported business growth and job creation. For example, the GI Bill provided veterans with education benefits, which helped them get better jobs and start businesses.
- Baby Boom: The baby boom generation was born between 1946 and 1964. This large group of children grew

original_tweet: THANK YOU TO THE GREAT DANA WHITE AND #UFC309! https://t.co/0zsThFsyTD
prefix: THANK YOU TO THE
original_completion: GREAT DANA WHITE AND #UFC309! https://t.co/0zsThFsyTD
completion:
MANY DONORS WHO SUPPORTED OUR 2019 CAMPAIGN!
Your generosity makes it possible for us to continue our mission of providing free legal services to low-income individuals and families in the Greater Philadelphia area. We are so grateful for your support.
The Legal Aid Society of Philadelphia is a nonprofit organization that provides free civil legal services to low-income residents of Philadelphia. Our clients are people who cannot afford to hire an attorney. We help them with problems like domestic violence, housing, public benefits, health care, employment, family law, and immigration. We also work to change laws and policies that create barriers for people living in poverty.
Legal Aid’s mission is to fight for fairness and justice by helping low-income people solve their civil legal problems. We believe that everyone should have access to justice, regardless of income. We provide free legal services to people who qualify based on income, and we work to change laws and policies that create barriers for people living in poverty. We also offer free legal advice at our Walk-In Clinics.
Legal Aid works to change laws and policies that create barriers for people living in poverty. We also work to improve access to justice through education and training, and we advocate for fair treatment of all people in the legal system.
We are proud to be part of the Pennsylvania Legal Aid Network (PLAN), a statewide network of nonprofit organizations that provide free legal services to low-income Pennsylvanians. PLAN member agencies serve every county in Pennsylvania, and together we handle more than 135,000 cases each year.
We are also proud to be part of the National Association of Consumer Advocates (NACA), a nationwide association of consumer attorneys dedicated to protecting consumers from unfair business practices. NACA members work to ensure that consumers are treated fairly and that they have access to justice. NACA members also work to protect consumers’ rights under federal and state laws.
The Legal Aid Society of Philadelphia is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your donation is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. Thank you for your support! If you would like to make a donation, please visit our website or contact us at |||PHONE_NUMBER||| . You can also mail your donation to The Legal Aid Society of Philadelphia, 1835 Market Street, Suite 700, Philadelphia, PA 19103. Thank you for your support! We could not do what we do without your help. Together, we can make a difference in the lives

original_tweet: A GREAT HONOR, THANK YOU! https://t.co/ALfxh0BDX5

BUT ALSO A GREAT RESPONSIBILITY.
The 2019-2020 school year will be my third as a principal at Westfield High School. I am honored to serve the students, staff, and community of Westfield. My goal is to create an environment where students are challenged academically and supported socially-emotionally. I believe that every student can learn and grow when given the proper tools and resources. We must work together to ensure that all students have access to these opportunities.
My commitment is to support our students in their pursuit of excellence. I want them to know that they are valued, respected, and loved. I will continue to advocate for the needs of our students and work with our community to provide the best possible education for all. Our students are the future leaders of our country, and we must do everything we can to prepare them for success. I look forward to working with you this school year to make Westfield High School an even better place for our students. Thank you for your continued support. Go Shamrocks! #WestfieldProud
Mr. Christopher S. Kowalski
Principal
